results.title: Japan’s Prime Minister to Step Aside After Just a Year in Office

results.title: The W.H.O. opens a Berlin hub to head off the next pandemic.
results.abstract: “Viruses must move fast, but data can move even faster,” the W.H.O.’s director said in inaugurating the new international project.

multimedia.caption: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany and Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the director general of the World Health Organization, inaugurate the agency’s Hub for Pandemic and Epidemic Intelligence in Berlin on Wednesday.

results.title: Shifting to Governing, Taliban Will Name Supreme Afghan Leader
results.abstract: Facing immense challenges in a devastated country, and a hard transition from war to administration, the Islamist movement is preparing to name a new, theocratic government.

results.title: ‘Finally, I Am Safe’: U.S. Air Base Becomes Temporary Refuge for Afghans
results.abstract: About a fifth of all people evacuated from Kabul were brought to Ramstein Air Base in Germany, where they await the next leg of their journey, to the United States.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

multimedia.caption: Ramstein Air Base in Germany on Tuesday, where thousands of Afghan evacuees are being housed before being flown to the United States.

results.title: Will the World Formally Recognize the Taliban?
results.abstract: The extremist group back in charge of Afghanistan has been a pariah to much of the world for its legacy of brutality, and the prospects for greater acceptance remain unclear.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

results.title: When Will the Delta Surge End?
results.abstract: The variant retreated unexpectedly in Britain and India, but has begun to rebound. The United States may take an even bumpier path, scientists said.
results.byline: By Apoorva Mandavilli, Benjamin Mueller and Shalini Venugopal Bhagat

results.title: Gail Omvedt, 80, Dies; India Became Her Home, the Caste System Her Cause
results.abstract: An American-born sociologist, she moved to India in the 1970s, helped pioneer the study of castes and drew attention to the lives of the country’s most oppressed.

multimedia.caption: The scholar and activist Gail Omvedt in 1980 at a national conference on women’s rights in Bombay (later renamed Mumbai). She drew attention to members of an oppressed caste once commonly called the untouchables.
multimedia.copyright: via Prachi Patankar

results.title: Piers Morgan Cleared for Criticizing Meghan After Oprah Interview
results.abstract: Mr. Morgan had been under investigation after he said on air that he did not believe Meghan’s claims that palace officials had refused her requests for mental health treatment.

results.title: Another Hidden Covid Risk: Lingering Kidney Problems
results.abstract: In a study of veterans, Covid survivors were 35 percent more likely than other patients to have long-term kidney damage or declines in kidney function.
org_facet: Clinical Journal of the American Society of Nephrology

multimedia.caption: Masha Crawford, a nurse, tends to a patient on dialysis at Providence St. John’s Health Center in Los Angeles. People hospitalized with Covid-19 are at greater risk of kidney damage, a new study finds.
